title: Digital Designer
description: We are in search of two Digital Designers with 3-6 years of experience in multimedia, graphic, or digital design to join our creative marketing team. This is a part-time( 24 hours a week) opportunity on a 6-month contract, offering the advantage to work remotely from the Philippines. Were eager to bring aboard individuals who are available to start immediately and can commit to the 6 months opportunity.Collaborating closely with our creative team and other members of the global marketing team, you will be producing a broad range of digital design solutions to support our marketing strategy. From bringing our marketing campaigns to life, following design briefs and brand guidelines with a focus on online advertising and global campaign implementation, you will be executing projects from conception through to production, producing digital assets for web banners, EDMs, campaign landing pages, social media channels as well as print work as required.Day- day responsibilities include : Designing promotional material and campaign assets for landing pages, email marketing, digital adverts, website banners and print collateral. Ensuring design best practices are followed. Contributing to idea generation and creative brainstorming and following guidelines to ensure consistency of brand and creative across all digital touchpoints. Bringing assets to life by creating animations and incorporating motion graphics. Producing content for internal and external communications across multiple social channels. Including YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, as well as online campaigns. Working on ad-hoc design projects as directed by the Website and Design Manager and regional Heads of Marketing. About You: Strong portfolio or show reel demonstrating your precise layout skills, exceptional eye for detail and passion for design Expert knowledge of Figma, and Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects and Media Encoder). Strong conceptualizing skills with the ability to come up with a range of creative options to any brief Ability to take creative concepts from ideation through to final deliverables across marketing touchpoints (social, video and static campaign assets, webinars, display and EDMs). Experience in creating and incorporating motion graphics into video. Demonstrated experience in video editing and production for media platforms across digital and social channels. Experience working with static and HTML5 digital display ads. Excellent communication, project management, and interpersonal skills; ability to work with a range of stakeholders and cross functional teams to deliver bespoke designs that meet their business needs in a practical and functional manner Ability to work in an entrepreneurial atmosphere; high degree of initiative, excels under pressure and with minimal supervision and works towards goals with a keen sense of urgency Bonus points if you have: Experience with video-editing or postproduction using Adobe Premiere and/or After Effects Experience working with Blender and 3D modelling. Interested? What next?Please apply and include a link to your portfolio with your application. We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you.About PepperstoneWe‚Äôre a regulated online Forex and CFD trading platform. With the scale of a global fintech and the agility of a start-up, we arm our clients with everything they need to take on the global markets with confidence. You will be part of a wider passionate and friendly team, and whilst things may not always go to plan, we learn quickly and move forward with impact. To learn even more visit Pepperstonecareers.com and www.linkedin.com/company/pepperstone/We will be reviewing applications as they come through, so if this is an opportunity that excites you, dont wait. Express your interest by clicking the apply button below as soon as possible.Pepperstone is an equal-opportunity employer. We are passionate about building a diverse workplace and strongly encourage applications from any background.

title: UI/UX (NFT Platform) Designer

title: Product Designer for Music Tech Startup
description: We are looking for a part-time product designer with 5-7 years experience in product design at consumer tech or ideally music/media tech companies. We are looking for someone with user-focused design principles and someone who is willing to collaborate with us to move fast as we iterate through our product development. Ability to work with Figma files, create quick wireframes, mockups or functioning prototype for feedback will be critical. We require the designer to be NY based and travel to our office in SoHo to collaborate with the team on ideas. There will be an opportunity to come on full-time if there is a mutual fit!

title: 3D Artist for product renderings
description: Stacvalley, Germanys leading marketing agency for Amazon sellers, is on the lookout for a talented and experienced 3D Artist to join our dynamic and creative team. While our headquarters are in Germany, this specific role is open to candidates interested in working remotely.As a 3D Artist at Stacvalley, youll be responsible for designing and creating high-quality 3D product visuals. Your creative abilities will play a pivotal role in narrating the story of each product and enticing buyers to press the purchase button.Responsibilities: Crafting detailed and realistic 3D models of products to be used on Amazon listings. Collaborating with the marketing and product team to ensure 3D visuals align with brand identity and enhance product appeal. Keeping abreast of the latest 3D design trends and techniques in the e-commerce industry. Adhering to project timelines and ensuring all 3D visuals meet the highest quality standards. Qualifications: A minimum of three years of experience in a 3D Artist role, ideally within an agency catering to Amazon or other e-commerce platforms. An impressive portfolio demonstrating your prowess in 3D modeling and visualization. Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects in a high-paced environment. Excellent communication skills with a penchant for embracing and acting on feedback. If youre passionate about molding the future of e-commerce visuals and aspire to carve the next chapter of your career at one of Germanys top agencies, we eagerly await your application. Your 3D artistry can redefine product presentations on Amazon, and were excited to pioneer that journey with you.

title: Creative Director
description: The OpportunityWe seek a highly experienced Creative Director with a strong, proven background in graphic design to lead IZEA‚Äôs brand team. Reporting to the Associate Vice President of Marketing, the Creative Director will focus on brand-building marketing initiatives that strengthen IZEA‚Äôs position as a leader in the influencer marketing industry. We are looking for someone who excels as a player and a coach. You will manage a team of in-house designers while also designing assets alongside your team. The ideal candidate must have a strong portfolio showcasing their skills in graphic design in both digital and print. The Creative Director will also work closely with other departments to ensure that all branding efforts meet IZEA‚Äôs high standards and align with our core values and mission. Your mission at IZEA Manage a team of designers to ensure high-quality, consistent, and effective creative output. Create and implement creative concepts that distinguish the brand from its competitors. Develop and execute strategic branding campaigns that align with the companys overall goals and objectives. Manage the overall brand strategy and guidelines, ensuring consistency across all marketing and communication channels. Oversee the development of all branding materials, including website design, social media graphics, videos, emails, print collateral, out-of-home advertising, tradeshow activations, paid media and all other marketing materials. Collaborate with IZEA‚Äôs Sales, Client Services and Product teams to maintain alignment across all of IZEA‚Äôs communications. Prepare and present design concepts to stakeholders and incorporate feedback to refine the final product. Manage multiple projects and prioritize workload to ensure that all materials are completed on time, within budget, and to a high-quality standard. Continuously improve the design process by identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes to increase efficiency and effectiveness. Stay current with industry trends and best practices, and incorporate them into the companys branding efforts. What you will bring to IZEA Bachelors degree in Graphic Design, Marketing, Communications, or a related field. 7+ years of experience in branding, with at least 3 years of experience in a management role. Creative and innovative thinking, with a passion for branding and design. Experience managing a team of designers, including the ability to provide constructive feedback and mentorship. Strong portfolio showcasing various design work, including digital illustration and typography. Expertise in using Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign, and Figma Experience in WordPress website development and management. Knowledge of HTML/CSS and web design Familiarity with Keynote and Google Slides. Strong understanding of design principles, including layout, color theory, and typography. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Proven experience developing and executing successful branding campaigns that drive results. Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with HubSpot is a plus. Excellent attention to detail and ability to multitask. A desire to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines and changing priorities. Experience in and a passion for influencer marketing is a plus. Curiosity and familiarity with the use of generative A.I. to be used in the creative process. How We Will Support You Our core values -- Love, courage, communication, teamwork, accountability, citizenship and fun -- showcase how we work day-to-day and the support we give our team members. We believe that by living our core values and empowering our team members, we can provide the support and encouragement they need to thrive. Modern Remote Workplace World-Class Healthcare - Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance Up to 16 weeks of Paid Parental Leave 401k with employer match Team Member RSU Equity Discounted Stock Purchase Plan Personal Time Off - not only your accrued days, but also 15 fixed company holidays and four ad-hoc, ‚Äúfloating‚Äù holidays Commitment to Personal Growth with an annual stipend of up to $1,000 Fitness Reimbursement Please note that: A successful candidate will be subject to a background check and must receive satisfactory results of the same, as a condition of joining the team. By applying for this role, you confirm that all information submitted is accurate and complete. You further acknowledge that providing false or fraudulent information during the application process is cause for denial of an offer, revocation of any existing offer, or other adverse action, up to and including termination after the start of your commencement of work. Don‚Äôt meet every requirement listed? Studies show that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs when they don‚Äôt meet every requirement. At IZEA, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive community, so if you think you could crush this role, even without all the listed qualifications, please apply! You may be exactly who we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer (Remote)
description: üöÄWhats the position?This is a Full-time UI/UX Designer position at Neybox for talented people who want to make a positive impact on the well-being of individuals worldwide.üí´What will I be working on?We have two apps: Pillow, a sleep-tracking app, and Today, which is a quantified-self wellness app. Both apps have won an Editors Choice distinction and have been featured multiple times in press and media. They have millions of users worldwide and a great roadmap ahead.ü§π‚ÄçWhat will be my role and responsibilities? Designing new features for our apps Redesigning existing features and functionality Maintaining and expanding our design systems Usability research Preparing animation prototypes, user flows and other accompanying material for each design iteration. Collaborating with team members (developers, designers, marketers etc.) as necessary. Being an awesome team member, helping and supporting your team members when they need you. üôÇ üåç Can I work remotely?Of course! Our team is 100% remote. We have flexible working hours, but a good overlap between our time zones is required and we do encourage normal working hours.üôå What is it like working at Neybox?Our team is small (6-8 people) but its growing. We work closely together every day (Mon-Fri). For coordination, we mainly use Slack and we keep meetings at a minimum. Theres no middle management to get in the way, and youll have direct access to all people responsible for the future of both apps.üíº What are the requirements? 3+ years of experience designing mobile applications primarily A strong portfolio demonstrating your involvement and contribution in various parts of the design process of real mobile apps. Bachelors degree in Design or a related field, or equivalent experience Proficient in Figma for UI design and prototyping Strong graphic design skills Excellent knowledge of prototyping and preparing user flows Proficient use of the English language. Good copywriting skills. Proficient in usage of MacOS and iOS References from previous employers in written or spoken form may be required. ‚ö°Ô∏è Bonus skills Illustration skills 3D design (Cinema 4d, Blender, 3DS Max), Motion Graphics and video editing (Premier Pro, After Effects) skills üòå Why youll love working at Neybox Designing award-winning apps helping millions of users world-wide live a better life. Collaborating with talented individuals that love what they do. Being part of a growing multi-cultural team that values and supports each member. Access to many learning resources and sponsored learning opportunities. Great salary with bonuses. A flexible working schedule. 24+ days of paid leave + public holidays. And more! üì• Great! How can I apply?Just hit the button Apply for this position button below! Please note that this is the only acceptable way to apply. All other ways of contacting Neybox about the position, will be rejected.

title: Full-Time Graphic Designer
description: About Us: Annalise.ai is on a mission to champion healthcare equity by democratizing access to quality care. We foster a collaborative environment where individuals are nurtured, supported, challenged, and inspired. Our award winning AI technology helps radiologists read scans and saves lives. Position Overview: We are seeking a talented Graphic Designer to join our Marketing Department. Working remotely you will play an important in creating impactful visual assets.Responsibilities: Design engaging brochures, fact sheets, social posts and compelling landing pages to promote our healthcare solutions. Craft visuals that convey complex health tech concepts in a clear and accessible manner. Ensure all design materials align resonate with our target audience. Qualifications: Proficiency in graphic design software such as Figma or Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign). Strong portfolio showcasing your expertise in brochures, landing pages, and visual communication. Solid understanding of design principles, typography, and color theory. Ability to work independently and at a good pace, manage deadlines, and adapt to changing project requirements. Skills Desired: Brochure design Landing page design Visual storytelling Attention to detail (able to proof own work) Creative thinking Video editing a bonus but not essential Note: This position is dedicated to graphic design for our Marketing Department, focusing on promotional materials and visual content. The role does not involve product design.Benefits: Join a friendly team passionate about making a difference in healthcare. Collaborative and super supportive work culture. Paid sick days and holidays. Full-time contract position. Ready to Create Impact? If youre excited to contribute your design skills to a purpose-driven company, apply now to be part of the Annalise.ai journey towards healthcare equity.

title: Graphic Designer
description: About Us:At Next Micro LLC, we arent just another e-commerce business. Were a family. A modern, collaborative team dedicated to innovation and the joy of creation. Our ethos? To evolve, refine, and illuminate the digital shopping realm. If you have the knack for translating visions into tangible art, come be a part of our journey as we widen our horizons in the digital space.The Role:Your canvas? Platforms like Amazon, Shopify, Facebook, and Google. We are on the lookout for a visionary who can intuit our brands essence, embrace our creative narrative, and transform them into powerful visuals.Starting Salary: Ranges between $1000-$1200Expect To: Craft and perfect visual content across a variety of mediums. Innovate, ideate, and integrate brand stories, making them resonate. Collaborate to bring creative solutions to visual challenges. You Are: Artistic: Your designs speak, evoke, and inspire. Meticulous: Attention to detail is your second nature. Skilled: Equipped with a profound knowledge of design tools like Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Lightroom. Proactive: You manage time like a pro, ensuring every deadline is met with quality work. Bonus Points For: A degree in Graphic Design or similar. Over 3 years of professional design experience. A flair for photography and photo-editing. Expertise in CSS3, HTML5, and JavaScript. In-depth understanding of the US markets pulse. Benefits: Be a key player in a rapidly growing e-commerce business. Continuous learning and skill enhancement opportunities. Collaborative and nurturing work environment. Flexibility to infuse your style and creativity. How to Join Us: Share a link to your portfolio, showcasing your best creations. Attach your CV and your 16personalities.com result. Fill out our form at: https://forms.monday.com/forms/ac3da2b1f26ccd20a42dd713d984923c Dont just design. Define. At Next Micro, create art that shapes e-commerce.

title: Product Designer
description: Company DescriptionGivebutter is the most-loved nonprofit fundraising platform, empowering millions of changemakers to raise more, pay less, and give better. Nonprofits use Givebutter to replace multiple tools so they can launch fundraisers and events, use donation forms and donor management (CRM), send emails and text blasts‚Äîall in one place. Instead of charging a traditional SaaS subscription fee, Givebutter is completely free to use with a 100% transparent tip-or-fee model.Givebutter has been certified as a Great Place to Work¬Æ in 2021, 2022, and 2023, and is the #1 rated nonprofit software company on G2 across multiple categories.Our mission is to empower the changemaker in all of us. We believe giving should be fun, so you‚Äôll want to do it again, and we also believe that work should be fun, so that you‚Äôll have the greatest impact. We are excited to hear from talented people who want to work with other talented people in making the world a butter place‚Äîand have fun along the way. Role DescriptionGivebutter is hiring a Product Designer to join our team. You‚Äôll work with the Product team to translate feature requirements into designs that reflect Givebutter‚Äôs design language and systems and that provides a buttery experience for fundraisers and donors. You‚Äôll collaborate with our other designers to continue to refine, improve, and document our design system. You‚Äôll also partner with the Engineering team to bring your designs to life in our platform and ensure that the implementation aligns with our product design standards. This role will play a key part in continuing to build a world-class platform that can help us on our mission to help empower the next billion changemakers. We want to hear from people who... Want to design a world-class, category-defining product Obsess over the details when design a UI Take a creative approach to product design and are interested in pushing boundaries to provide users with the best experience possible. Responsibilities Collaborate with Product and Engineering to plan and execute on the product roadmap Design wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups that communicate design concepts and product requirements Work closely with the Product and Design teams to manage and improve our product design system to ensure consistency and efficiency in the design and implementation process Perform design reviews on front-end changes to ensure they match designs and meet our product design standards Continuously iterate and improve existing designs based on user feedback or product trends Present designs to stakeholders, such as CX and engineering, and actively engage in constructive feedback sessions Requirements 3+ years of product design experience, with a portfolio that highlights launched web applications Experience creating wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups Strong understanding of UI and UX design principles and best practices, including best practices for mobile and accessibility Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality pixel perfect designs Proficient understanding of interaction patterns for both desktop and mobile web applications Experience with Figma BenefitsRemote Work: Work from anywhere in the United States.Health Insurance: We offer Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance covered 100% for employees as well as HSA and FSA accounts.Mental Health: Givebutter health insurance plans come with access to a TalkSpace membership. 401k: We offer access to a retirement planning account for all employees.Vacation and Holiday: Take up to 15 days of paid vacation time per year plus additional days per year with the company. We also take off all 10+ Federal Holidays and provide 2 floating holidays.Parental Leave: We offer 12 weeks paid parental leave for both primary and secondary caregivers. Home Office Stipend: Upgrade your home office with company-sponsored expenses including high-quality laptops, monitors, and modern technology.Charitable Giving: Employees are encouraged to donate up to $50/month to any verified nonprofit they wish to support on Givebutter.Professional Development: We offer learning and development reimbursement opportunities.Love What You Do: We are a mission-driven company serving the charitable sector. Feel good about the work youre doing and the company you work for.A recent study from LinkedIn showed that most women apply to jobs only when they meet 100% of the requirements, whereas men will hit the apply button if they hit 60%. Givebutter is committed to building a diverse and inclusive team - so to the women and nonbinary folks out there feeling unsure if youre a perfect fit, we strongly encourage you to apply!

title: Graphic (Marketing) Designer
description: To apply please submit your portfolio and a brief cover letter explaining why you are interested to creative@ispot.tv.IntroductionWe are seeking a highly creative and talented Visual Designer to assist our marketing team. As a Visual Designer, you will play a crucial role in shaping our brand identity and creating visually compelling marketing materials to support our business objectives.Responsibilities Design engaging and impactful marketing materials, including report covers, social graphics, web pages, one sheets, white papers, and other visual marketing assets. Develop and maintain a consistent brand image across all marketing materials. Generate fresh ideas and innovative design concepts that align with our brand guidelines. Ensure designs are optimized for various channels and platforms, including digital and print. Conduct design reviews and incorporate feedback to refine designs. Requirements Proven work experience as a Visual Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your creative skills. Proficiency in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Knowledge of Canva is a plus. Solid understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout composition. Experience designing marketing materials for digital and print mediums with strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively present and explain design concepts. Candidates regularly available during US working hours will be given priority.

title: UX Designer
description: Ethyca (https://ethyca.com) is a high-growth Series A remote startup on a mission to make Trust, Respect and Privacy a default feature of every tech stack. To accomplish this, we created the Fides open source language for data privacy (https://ethyca.com/fides/) and its related suite of free developer tools to enforce privacy policies as code, automate users‚Äô right to access and erase their data, and much more. We believe software engineers are uniquely equipped to solve modern privacy challenges, but only if we work together on shared standards and best practice tools - come join our team and help make this a reality!As Ethycas inaugural UX designer, you‚Äôll be responsible for designing our developer experiences from the initial mockups all the way through the front-end framework, and consulting on implementation. As a member of the product team, you‚Äôll help to distill product requirements into low- or high-fidelity wireframes and facilitate a seamless transition to implementation with the engineering team. Your super power is understanding complex engineering concepts and translating them into a user experience for non-technical users across any enterprise vertical: lawyers, product managers, and business operations resources. This is not an entry-level role, as you will need to understand human-to-computer interaction for a new product that is unlike any that current exist today. What you will do Champion UX best practices to ensure we‚Äôre all making informed design decisions together. Work with product and engineering team to craft achievable design solutions using your experience (or dribbble and codepen search skills!) that can be implemented quickly and will lead to immediate value for the user community. Build prototypes, wireframes and high-fidelity mockups using design tools like Invision, Figma and Sketch to workshop and develop on requirements. Build prototypes or bootstrap components using React or Angular to help convey an idea to other engineers and stakeholders. Analyze KPIs to identify underlying trends, develop hypotheses, test and evaluate new iterations of design systems and UX. Occasionally, work with the product team to perform UX research studies, help develop product roadmap, and soundboard product marketing ideas. Who you are A former or current engineer, or just an engineer at-heart. You have at least 3 years of experience implementing front-end web technologies (oo js, react, angular etc) and against web standards including html5 and css3. A skilled designer and eager to learn. You have at least 4 years experience designing and building product experiences for end-users and have shipped design for a product used by a significant user base. You have a have a strong understanding of user-centered design and product thinking when making design decisions, and you back that understanding with compelling design solutions. You are able to quickly build up an understanding of all experiences and touch points that go into delivering value to our customers. An empathetic interaction designer. You craft high quality, end to end experiences. You build straightforward user flows, information architecture, and utilize the tenants of strong interaction design in your work. You leverage design systems for consistency and pay attention to the details of each screen. You work with engineers to ship experiences that are usable and aesthetically pleasing. Firm believer in user-centered design thinking. At Ethyca, our users are lawyers, business operations, and engineers; your being an engineer and bridging compliance/privacy needs with design for a diversity of user types is instrumental to the success of the product. You enjoy learning from customers and team members, and you‚Äôre comfortable participating in research regularly to test, clarify or validate assumptions. You know how to measure the results of your work and understand its downstream effects on users and compliance rqeuirements. A skilled written communicator. You are comfortable writing some in-product copy and light technical education materials. You believe in the power of succinct, efficient copy for the product as a part of the user experience. Your excellent communication style (verbally and written) to internal product, engineering and design teams should bring clarity and direction to conversations. We are hiring US-based candidates for this remote role with a preference toward candidates in the NYC area as the role will require East coast working hours.Benefits Competitive cash + equity compensation 100% medical and dental insurance coverage Flexible office hours & vacation policy Parental leave 401K About EthycaWe are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other protected characteristics.Ethyca is a distributed team with headquarters in NYC and remote workers across the US. When it‚Äôs safe to meet again, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to travel to NYC a few times a year for company events. We are currently unable to sponsor visas so require that you are authorized to work in the USA.We‚Äôre an engineering company building a missing piece of the Internet‚Äôs infrastructure: the trust layer that empowers users and businesses to manage data respectfully. Every day, we‚Äôre solving challenges for customers and thinking about the future of human rights as society increasingly moves online. If this sounds intriguing and you‚Äôre excited to shape that future with us, we‚Äôd love to talk to you!

title: Brand Design
description: Free Agency is a talent startup modernizing how people find & succeed at work. We provide concierge services and digital products to knowledge workers, mirroring Hollywood-style talent representation and management. Unlike recruiters, we‚Äôre entirely paid by and motivated by the individual candidates we work with, enabling us to focus on their career outcomes. Their success is our success.We‚Äôve started with the tech industry: through our platform, mid to C-level folks in product, engineering, design, marketing, and ops are doing incredible work at companies like Square, Drift, Roblox, Reddit, Netflix, Amazon, SpaceX, Notion, Peloton, and hundreds more. We‚Äôre backed by top-tier venture capital firms like Resolute Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, and Ludlow Ventures.About the job:Were looking to engage an incredible brand designer to help us refresh our overall brand style. This is specifically not about our logo, which we love and intend to keep, but instead about everything else related to our visual presence.The ideal designer should have significant time to dedicate to the project, as we want to be on the other side of our brand refresh on a relatively short timeframe without sacrificing quality. This is a remote role and we intend to pay hourly to enable iterative work, design feedback, and a dynamic scope.You will work with the co-founder & CEO on: Overall brand style and visual themes, including color scheme, logo usage, fonts, photography, and general treatment. Graphic direction (other designers are available to contribute), including iconography and data visualization. Visual design exploration, including web layout, one-pager + deck design, social images, and blog design. At the end of our time together, Free Agency should have an incredible brand design and style guide to use. If its of mutual interest, we will continue to engage strong designers for continued work, consulting on one-off projects, and adjacent needs (print + swag).Here are some things we care about when it comes to design: Were a consumer-facing service but with a high ticket price. Therefore, we want to be both welcoming (warm) and trustworthy (serious), which can be a hard balance to strike. Sleek comes to mind. We work with people and companies in the tech industry, including the latest + greatest startups. It is important for our design to be modern and provide a sense of zeitgeist & recency. We arent looking for very rigid design -- in other words, when it comes to our overall palette, we think its great when brands do ad campaigns or fun social graphics that stretch beyond what they use on their landing page. If Free Agency, our brand, and our intention sound intriguing, wed love to hear from you.

title: Design Coach
description: About MentoMento is a career tech company. We‚Äôre on a mission to provide people access to to the best career advice in the world, and empower them take action on it. In a world where jobs and careers are rapidly changing, were equipping people with the products, information, and support to build and maintain meaningful careers.We strive to create a fun, conscientiousness, collaborative, and supportive work environment, and are looking for several team members to join us! We are a remote-first company based in the US and Europe with over $5.5M raised from VCs including Twelve Below, M13, Slow Ventures, NextGen VP, and AngelList Quant, among others.About The RoleWe are looking for a career coach to specialize in supporting Product and Graphic Design professionals. From working with them on their daily work, to their broader career goals, you will support professionals throughout all aspects of their careers.Your day-to-day responsibilities will include: Serving as the main point of contact for our users. Providing 1:1 coaching, feedback, and support through virtual sessions as well as text, email, etc. Support professionals through group coaching and one-to-many sessions. Asynchronous feedback and review on content and materials. Working with the Mento team to improve the product and user experience Being an integral member of the coaching team ‚Äî helping enhance our coaching practices and developing materials to deliver an incredible user experience and fulfill our mission of helping people thrive in jobs that they love. Acting with kindness and respect as an ambassador and representative of the Mento community Who are you? Passionate about helping people advance in the workplace, and find and build fulfilling careers. 5+ years experience working in the tech industry in Design or a Creative position! Ideally, you have experience working as a career coach (though coaching certificates are not required!). A high EQ person with acts with empathy and can create a safe space for people. You understand that there are glorious and not so glorious aspects to any job. We are a startup and we all wear many hats! Comfortable with navigating ambiguity! Other details This is a part-time position paid hourly with performance bonus. You must have bandwidth to put minimum 5 hours per week towards Mento. We will start with a 6-month initial commitment, more is great. Remote position. Candidates are preferably US-based. üî• Apply for this role! We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We truly don‚Äôt care about your credentials! If you‚Äôre passionate about helping more people access sustainable, better paid careers, we want to hear from you.

title: Senior Designer
description: Harley & Co. is an award-winning, internationally recognized creative and entertainment studio that specializes in media properties, experiences, identity design and narrative content. We work at the crossroads of audio/video series, campaigns, physical installations and graphic design. We are looking for a senior designer who is creative, talented with an eye for typography, design and layout. The senior designer should be someone who loves to use design to tell complex stories that shift culture. They should have a passion for film, photography, typography and contemporary ways to apply graphic design. They should believe that design, if used well, can be a transformative tool for change. This job requires someone who is endlessly curious and loves learning new things. You should bring proficient skills within the Adobe Suite (Photoshop and Illustrator, InDesign required) C4D and after effect knowledge is a plus as you will be creating design assets across multiple platforms. The company currently operates on a remote basis with all employees and has a centrally located headquarters in New York City. Developing big ideas within practical considerations that connect to culture.¬∑ Collaborate with our Creative Director and Senior Art Director to execute brand vision for our clients¬∑ Have strong understanding of how to shape narratives, and an appreciation for strategic thinking¬∑ Get into the details, review & refine briefs, understand project plans & staffing, and be constantly thinking about how to set the team up for success What You Bring:‚óè Bachelor Degree in Design, minimum 5-7 years of experience‚óè Comfort working across discipline‚óè Proficiency in Adobe Suite - Photoshop and Illustrator required - InDesign, and After Effects a plus.‚óè Print experience with strong typography and layout skills‚óè Ability to take feedback and learn from experts in the field of design and creative thinking What We Value:‚óè Compassion: Empathy for the people our work supports and our colleagues‚óè Curiosity: A continuous ambition to learn and apply new knowledge/techniques cross platforms‚óè Adaptability: Ability to wear multiple hats and working outside of your comfort zone‚óè Composure & Poise: A level-minded demeanor through client feedback and fast working conditions

title: Lead Product Designer
description: About TixTrackTixTrack is re-inventing the way live entertainment companies and attractions sell tickets to their events. Our software is used by industry leaders such as The Walt Disney Company, Cirque du Soleil, Meow Wolf and The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. Through our platforms, we‚Äôll sell over $1 billion dollars in tickets in 2022. Our products have been driving tremendous growth for our customers sales and, as a result, TixTrack is now experiencing our fastest growth ever. We‚Äôre looking for a great Lead Designer to help continue our success!The PositionThis is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing tech company as the lead designer for our live entertainment ticketing system. You will help transform the ticketing industry by designing a ticket buying process that both increases sales and is pleasant for ticket buyers. In this role you will collaborate with founders, product managers, engineers and customers to design simple, user-friendly and beautiful designs for all things TixTrack including the UI for our web-based software.Requirements Experience creating highly intuitive and beautiful user interfaces across a variety of environments (web apps, dashboards, e-commerce, mobile etc.) Introduce UI patterns and best practices which ultimately define TixTrack‚Äôs visual language. A passion for solving complex problems while owning all aspects of the design (user experience, visual & interaction design). Excellent design skills using tools like Figma. Experience designing re-usable web component libraries for front end frameworks like React, Vue or Angular. Keen understanding of color theory, web typography, and user psychology. An online portfolio with an outstanding body of work that demonstrates experience designing intuitive web-based interfaces. Other nice to haves: Ability to code HTML/CSS/SASS/LESS. Experience designing for e-commerce, enterprise software or mobile apps. QualificationsA bachelors degree in a design-related discipline such as graphic design, human-computer interaction or communications is preferred.Benefits and Work EnvironmentThis is a remote position in a remote-first company. Although we are serious about success, we strive for a fun and friendly work environment where everyone enjoys their job. TixTrack is a young company, but unlike many companies of our size, we are already profitable. Competitive salary and equity opportunities. Full healthcare benefits (Medical PPO, Dental, Vision). Generous paid vacation and holidays. 401K.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: About Us: Lessonface.com is a vibrant online platform that connects music and arts enthusiasts of all ages with expert teachers for immersive and inspiring learning experiences, called by the LA Times the best option for teaching music online. For over ten years, we have been committed to fostering a creative & equitable environment where music and art students and teachers meet and interact, and we have a large and growing truly enthusiastic community as a result. Now, were seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our bootstrapped team on a contract basis and take our platform to new heights.Role Overview: As UI/UX Designer, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the user experience on Lessonface.com. There is near-infinite room for impact in our expanding universe filled with enthusiastic users on both the student and teacher sides. You will be a key part of a small, passionate and engaged team improving our music and arts education platform. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with leadership to conceptualize and execute design solutions. Update and improve the existing user interface, creating designs that may reference modern design trends, but are not solely trendy, nor generic. Design and prototype new features that enhance user engagement and satisfaction, ensuring a consistent and intuitive experience. Assess user research and help to gather feedback to inform design decisions, incorporating user insights into your designs. Develop wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes to illustrate design concepts and workflows. Ensure responsive design principles are applied, allowing for a seamless user experience across various devices and screen sizes. Participate in usability testing and iterate on designs based on user feedback, striving to continuously improve the user experience. Qualifications: Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer, with a portfolio showcasing your design skills and creative problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, or similar software. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles, with an ability to translate user needs into elegant design solutions. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and basic JavaScript concepts, enabling effective communication with development teams. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, self-motivated mindset to work effectively, without a lot of oversight, within a fairly flat team environment. Familiarity with the latest design trends, interaction patterns, and user experience best practices, ultimately moderated with an core appreciation for timeless concepts that transcend trends. Appreciation for great teachers and music and arts education. Contract Details: Duration: Ongoing Location: Remote Compensation: $40-$100/hr, for 10-20 hours a week, depending on your experience level and availability Start Date: September 15, 2023 Join us in shaping the future of online music and arts education. If youre a passionate UI/UX Designer with an eye for detail, a dedication to user-centric design, and appreciation for the inspiration and guidance of great teachers, apply now and lets create something exceptional together!To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter outlining your design philosophy and relevant experience to hr@lessonface.com.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: CTC is a remote-first SaaS company backed by AirTree ventures, we‚Äôre out to build the best tax software for the web3 world. We have challenging design problems, an extremely capable engineering team and an unwavering commitment to building the best possible designs for our customers. Everything we do is geared towards maximising throughput and minimising BS Work with an exceptional and passionate team. conduct end to end research initiatives to discover and validate design concepts Can influence the shape of the product through research and data execute designs using wireframes, user journeys, interactive prototypes and high fidelity visual designs Has extremely refined and polished visual design skills Partners with engineers and others to ensure a high-quality implementation Has experience building highly refined figma components and maintaining design systems Has knowledge of HTML/CSS, and experience working with engineering teams to ensure accurate implementation of designs Prides themselves on well executed, polished experiences What you will do Contribute to the overall product and design direction of the company Work cross functionally with engineers and other partners Come up with features and improvements that ship quickly with high quality Evolve our internal design system Create flows, prototypes and high-fidelity visuals Help with hiring and establishing a design culture within the company Conduct customer interviews and usability tests What we value Passion about design, figuring out best-in-class solutions to complex problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Passion for technology, the future and strategy Compassion for our customers Resilience in the face of challenges Strong beliefs, loosely held A good working knowledge of crypto and web3 or a background in tax, fintech or data intensive products is nice to have Must have 5+ years in product design Portfolio of past work Highly refined and polished design style Experience in B2C and B2B SaaS products Experience working for a product-focused tech company If you are a highly motivated, passionate and organized individual who is looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we encourage you to apply.

title: Lead UI/UX SaaS Product Designer
description: Company Overview: At Praetorian, our vision is to create a future without compromise and our mission is to prevent breaches before they occur. title: Sr Product Designer-Digital Collectibles

title: Designer
description: Company DescriptionMechanism is an early-stage venture firm that partners with entrepreneurs to launch and scale ambitious companies.In our model, we work to identify and validate opportunities before creating every business. We then provide the growth expertise to gain early traction as well as the business support to establish positive unit economics, profitability, and scale.In addition to investment and strategic guidance, we offer extensive operational support for our startups in critical areas, including Growth, Product, Design, Operations, People, Finance, and Legal. Our in-house experts are at the top of their fields and are here to provide world-class support and expertise helping our startups get off the ground and scale.As a team, we have deep expertise across growth marketing, and it‚Äôs an important part of our company-wide culture. When it comes to launching and scaling companies, we don‚Äôt guess. We engineer.Our success rate of getting companies profitable is 100%, and our team has a track record of investing in and cofounding multiple companies with $100M+ revenue.Position DescriptionWe are seeking a talented and experienced freelance designer with a strong focus on revenue growth, branding, and marketing design. In this role, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and user-friendly digital touchpoints that drive conversions and support our growth marketing initiatives. Your expertise in both design principles, branding, and marketing strategies will be essential in elevating our portfolio companies‚Äô online presence and maximizing revenue opportunities. You‚Äôll work closely with our product team and our portfolio companies‚Äô internal teams. If you are passionate about creating impactful designs that attract and engage users, while optimizing for business growth, we would love to have you on our team.What Youll DoLearn about our portfolio companies markets and their user demographics: Gain a deep understanding of the markets in which our portfolio companies operate and familiarize yourself with the unique characteristics and preferences of their target audiences. This knowledge will help you create designs that effectively resonate with and engage their specific user demographics.Bring portfolio companies brands, platforms, and websites (marketing and e-commerce) to the next level: Elevate the visual identity and user experience of our portfolio companies brands and websites. Collaborate with the growth marketing teams to develop design strategies that align with their overall goals and enhance brand recognition, while ensuring a cohesive and seamless user experience across all touchpoints.Create landing pages, user acquisition flows, and SEO pages: Design compelling landing pages and user surveys and quizzes that drive conversions and capture leads. Utilize your understanding of SEO best practices to optimize the website pages for search engine visibility and improve organic traffic. Ensure that the landing pages and SEO pages are visually appealing, user-friendly, and aligned with the marketing objectives of the portfolio companies.Collaborate with the portfolio companies‚Äô CEOs and product teams to conduct A/B testing of different design solutions. Use data-driven insights to evaluate the performance of various designs, iterate on them, and refine the user experience. By continuously experimenting and optimizing, you will contribute to improving conversion rates and overall user engagement.Conduct usability tests to gather feedback on the usability and intuitiveness of website designs. Conduct user interviews to gain insights into user behavior, preferences, and pain points. Apply the insights gathered from these activities to refine and enhance the user experience, ensuring that the designs effectively meet the needs and expectations of the target audience.Leverage AI and tools to support your design and research efforts. This may include using AI-powered analytics tools to gain insights from user data, utilizing AI-driven design tools to automate repetitive tasks, or employing AI-based algorithms to personalize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging AI trends and incorporate them into your design process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.Who You AreYou are humble. You operate with intellectual honesty and check our egos at the door. You are receptive, adaptable, and we help each other succeed. You are fast. You optimize for speed of learning, execution, and growth. You do not get blocked easily. You are data-driven. You trust data over intuition. You don‚Äôt guess. You engineer.You are an overachiever. You partner with CEOs as cofounders and go all in. You know start-up life is not 9-5 and that excites you. You drive your own accountability and take pride in doing great work. A win for a portfolio company is a win for Mechanism.You play the long game. You do the things today that will help us tomorrow. You optimize for the long-term enterprise value (EV) of Mechanism portfolio companies and know significant companies take years to build.You are passionate. You actively promote a positive, high-energy culture of high performance, connection, and trust. You believe life is short, so you enjoy it and do what you love.What Youll BringProven experience as a Growth Designer, preferably in a revenue-focused or marketing-driven environment.Experience with Google Analytics and design tools such as Figma, Adobe CS, and FullStory. Strong understanding of UX/UI principles and ability to create visually appealing, user-friendly designs that align with marketing goals.Knowledge of responsive design principles and experience in designing websites for optimal performance across various devices and screen sizes.Solid understanding of SEO principles and best practices and the ability to implement SEO strategies into website designs.Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, content, and development teams.Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset to evaluate the effectiveness of designs and make data-informed optimizations.Ability to context switch effectively and manage multiple projects simultaneously.A keen eye for detail and a passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging design techniques.Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with the ability to collaborate effectively with developers for seamless implementation.Location and Time CommitmentWe are fully remote - you can work wherever you‚Äôre most productive. This role is freelance, and meetings will need to overlap with US EST.

title: Multimedia Designer
description: The Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) Marketing Department is hiring a creative and detail-oriented Multimedia Designer responsible for the creative and visual production of quality, creative storytelling using the Adobe Creative Suite.As a Multimedia Designer, you will play a crucial role in creating visually compelling and engaging multimedia content to support our marketing and communication initiatives, both online and offline. You will be both a graphic designer and a video producer.About the OrganizationThe Association of Proposal Management Association represents 12,000+ bid, capture, and business development professionals who identify, write, manage, or service bids for their organizations. APMP members are responsible for winning new work for their organizations, and its members are seen as a primarily economic engine in their company. APMP is a U.S.-based non-profit association with 29 chapters worldwide. APMP was formed in 1989.APMP operates in a 100% virtual environment, which means this position often operates independently. This position reports to a supervisor who lives and works in the United States (in the Central Standard Time zone)Multimedia Designer Responsibilities: Design and develop multimedia assets: Utilize your creative skills and expertise in multimedia design to conceptualize, design, and produce a wide range of multimedia assets, including but not limited to icons, graphics, illustrations, animations, videos, and infographics. Visual storytelling: Develop visual narratives that effectively convey key messages, brand identity, and product features through compelling multimedia content. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals and objectives and transform them into visually appealing and impactful designs. Brand consistency: Ensure that all multimedia designs adhere to brand guidelines and visual standards, maintaining a consistent and cohesive brand presence across various platforms and channels. Implement design elements that enhance brand recognition and resonate with our target audience. Multimedia production: Use industry-standard software and tools to create and edit multimedia content. This includes graphic design software, video editing software, animation software, and other relevant tools to produce high-quality deliverables. Collaboration and communication: Work closely with the marketing team and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, provide creative input, and deliver projects within established timelines. Effectively communicate ideas and collaborate on multimedia projects to ensure alignment with overall marketing strategies. Project management and deadlines: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks with your supervisor, and meet project deadlines without compromising quality. Ensure efficient workflow and effective time management to deliver high-quality multimedia assets on time. Multimedia Designer Requirements: At least three years‚Äô experience in a similar role. You must have a portfolio of multimedia design content showcasing your skills and experience to be considered for this position. In-depth knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects). Strong creative skills with the ability to develop compelling visual narratives and translate complex ideas into visually appealing designs. An eye for aesthetics, composition, color, and typography. Ability to collaborate on long-term projects. Excellent knowledge of storyboarding and visual design principles.. Artistic with an eye for aesthetics and visually appealing content. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Compensation:‚Ç¨52,000/year or ¬£45,000/year

title: Product Designer, Growth
description: Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more ‚Äì every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.Loom DesignDesign is a vital organization at Loom. By radically improving the experience of recording and sharing quick video messages, we are creating a new and more humane way of communicating at work. This requires us to think big and to discover and explore uncharted territory. Thats why were focused on building a diverse, and resilient design organization, full of talented people who love feedback and collaboration. Loom is a remote-first company, and Design is no exception: were hiring the best Designers, Researchers, and Writers from around the world, wherever they are. The RoleWe‚Äôre hiring a Product Designer to help design the future of Loom as we grow our user base. Growth Product Designers work on initiatives that increase the amount of creators, viewers, and teams on Loom ‚Äì empowering millions of people to communicate faster and more effectively at work. You will be a part of a tight-knit team, delivering massive value through both small, iterative tests and foundational, vision projects. Some examples of the work you will be doing are improvements to our new user onboarding, increasing team invites, and helping users build a habit with Loom. You‚Äôll partner with every team across Product, Design, Marketing, and Engineering to help drive activation, engagements and team expansion. You will define best practices, design for challenges both big and small, and lay the foundations for our product for years to come. Responsibilities Design delightful and educational onboarding experiences that give people the confidence, context and understanding to record and share their first Looms. Educating users how to form a habit of communicating with video at work through nudges and other educational levers Carve paths for teams and individuals to easily invite and engage with teammates on loom Simplify our roles and self-serve funnel to drive monetization amongst individuals and teams Help drive our core metrics for activation, engagement, acquisition, and monetization Be a key part of a well-rounded team of Design, PM and Engineering. Contribute to the Lens Design System Work cross-functionally with Product and Engineering partners to represent the design team, and give feedback in critique, roadmapping, sprint planning, and product and design Slack channels. Help Recruit and interview new Product Designers, and actively improve our inclusive design hiring process. What Were Looking For Experience in Product Design organizations that have shipped software to users, working closely with Product and Engineering teammates to develop the strategy and rationale for features. Demonstrable experience working with data, conducting and measuring product design experiments, and a passion for setting and achieving OKRs and metrics that materially impact the business. An outstanding portfolio, with presentable case studies showcasing a foundation in typography, interaction and visual design, product sense, and idea generation. Experience collaborating with a diverse team in a rapid growth environment. Huge plus if you‚Äôve worked with remote teammates and understand the communication patterns of working with highly distributed teams. A learning and growth mindset: We‚Äôre an early-stage startup, and we‚Äôre growing quickly. Our team size and our design process will evolve and change many times over the next few years. We strive to continuously improve, iterate, and integrate what we learn ‚Äî from our work and with each other. Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions. Empathy and resilience: empathy for our customers, to build a product and a service they‚Äôll love. Empathy for our coworkers, to build a workplace we‚Äôll love. Resilience to be able to take feedback from anywhere, consider it gracefully, and fold it into your thinking and your work. Excellent written, verbal, and storytelling skills How We WorkFreedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. We are able to hire across the United States and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation. Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe theres a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‚Äòsync time‚Äô is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so youre able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline for Summer Break around 4th of July and between Christmas and New Years. Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether its watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether its through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.Perks at Loom Competitive compensation and equity package 99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees) Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA) Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees) Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance 401(k) with 4% company matching Professional development reimbursement Wellness stipends Unlimited PTO Paid parental leave Remote work opportunities Home office & technology reimbursement Loom = Equal Opportunity EmployerWe are actively seeking to create a diverse work environment because teams are stronger with different perspectives and experiences.We value a diverse workplace and encourage women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, older members of society, and others from minority groups and diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All employees and contractors of Loom are responsible for maintaining a work culture free from discrimination and harassment by treating others with kindness and respect.

title: Product/Marketing Designer for SaaS App
description: About the job:DesignFiles is an interior design project management software company on a mission to help interior designers and home furnishing retailers take their design services and businesses to new heights. With 5,000+ customers and 20+ team members located all over the world, were growing quickly and looking for our next driven and talented team member.We‚Äôre looking for a Product/Marketing Designer to join the company to help drive product design from the ground level.What youll do: Create intuitive, user-friendly, and visually appealing user interfaces for our software products, ensuring a seamless and delightful user experience. Collaborate closely with product managers and developers to understand user needs, translate them into design concepts, and iterate on designs based on user feedback. Conduct user research and usability testing to gather insights and validate design decisions. Help design and maintain a consistent visual identity and brand guidelines across all marketing materials, including website, landing pages, social media graphics, and email campaigns. Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling visual assets that effectively communicate our value proposition to our target audience. Stay up to date with the latest design trends, industry best practices, and emerging technologies to continuously improve our software and marketing materials. Contribute to the development of design systems and design patterns to ensure a consistent and scalable user experience across our software products. What we want from you: Proven experience as a UI/UX designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your design skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar software. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices, with a keen eye for aesthetics and typography. Experience conducting user research, usability testing, and gathering actionable insights. Understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to cross-functional teams. Self-motivated, proactive, and able to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously. Passion for interior design, architecture, or related industries is a plus. Sound interesting?:Then wed love to hear about you! Please apply here: https://designfiles.homerun.co/ui-ux-marketing-designer-for-saas-app/en

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Ahoy there!Our agency is seeking a contractor-based Senior Product Designer with 7+ years experience to join our crew!Were looking for a candidate experienced in product design and project management who is passionate about creating cutting-edge, modern design interfaces while understanding how to think from an end user‚Äôs perspective to create meaningful experiences that tell stories and increase engagement.RESPONSIBILITIES Craft intuitive, engaging, and memorable user interfaces for web and mobile applications Create wireframes, high-fidelity designs, and interactive prototypes to help visualize design ideas and solutions Create information architectures, user flows, user journey maps, etc. to ensure a smooth user experience Craft design solutions for websites, web apps, mobile apps, smart watch, and the like using Figma Create low-fidelity and high-fidelity design concepts, taking design projects from kickoff, through concept, to final product Collaborate directly with clients, leading and guiding design projects from inception to completion Test designs to ensure usability and accessibility Visualize user experiences (UX) and create user interfaces (UI) for a wide variety of clients, industries, and audiences Maintain brand and design element consistency across platforms Are familiar with the latest UX Research Methodologies and can conduct UX Research sessions and drive productivity Work collaboratively with our highly skilled design, development, product management crew, and other stakeholders to convert business requirements into effective product experiences Participate in client meetings, including leading presentations and asking questions to acquire all information necessary to help make informed design decisions to complete projects accurately and efficiently Are up-to-date on the latest design trends and technologies to create cutting-edge design solutions QUALIFICATIONS Expertise using Figma as your primary design program Proficient creating Figma prototypes Extensive experience in design, ideally in a senior/lead role within an agency environment Must have experience designing for numerous product UIs including websites, dashboards, SaaS platforms, mobile apps, smart watch, design systems, etc. Must have experience designing mobile-responsive websites and applications, coupled with a strong understanding of responsive design principles Must have the ability to turn internal and client feedback into effective design concepts and visuals Must be able to manage a project from client interaction to design-to-development handoff, followed by QA Must understand the collaboration relationship between design and development Must have experience working with developers to create implementation-ready layouts, assets, and resources A demonstrated passion for design, storytelling, products, & brands Experience working with clients directly (conference calls and emails when necessary) Experience with balancing and managing multiple projects simultaneously Experienced and competent in design & application best practices Able to communicate through Slack and Google Meet Able to work independently, are self-managed and self-motivated, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment BONUSES Experience animating interfaces using After Effects, Principle, etc. Experience creating animations & micro-animations Experience creating vectors, SVGs, & illustrations Actively participating on popular creative community platforms like Dribbble or Behance There is a lot of potential to grow with us!
